page.title: 05Churches and Chapels
page.content: The denomination of churches and chapels in the area is either {Methodist}or{Church of England,}with the exception of a{Quaker Meeting {House}at St.Paul's Terrace. {Shortlanesend}has a{Methodist Chapel with congregation of about 17. In Truro there is the{St.Mary-Clement {Methodist Church,}one of the largest of its kind in Cornwall, congregation over 400. The present church was formed about 10 years ago when St.Mary's amalgamated with the closed St.Clement Church. The C.of E. have two parish churches, one at{Kenwyn, the other at{St.Paul's}in Agar Road. Congregation at Kenwyn is 160-190, at St.Paul's 250-300. It was found that the greater congregations assembled at Sunday morning services and a lesser number at evening services.
